page.title: 04THE ROYAL YACHT SQUADRON
page.content: The{R.Y.S.}occupies{Cowes Castle, which was built by Henry VIII.It is now the H.Q. of one of the most famous yacht clubs in the world.Membership is exclusive,including the Royal Family.All are British males,although there is a ladies lounge & dining room.Inside are lots of beautiful things.In the 19th.century regattas organised by members made Cowes a world famous yachting-centre.The tradition continues in 1985.The castle is now used for the start of many races.Distinguished guests attend dinner parties at the Squadron.During Cowes Week there will be 80 guests each evening.It is formal & old fashioned.The waitresses are paid a standard rate,but enjoy meeting some very interesting people.The R.Y.S. has played a unique part in the development of Cowes.
